Previous Next

netsquid.qubits.ketstates

Defines some common ket state vectors.

netsquid.qubits.ketstates.s0 = array([[1.+0.j],        [0.+0.j]])

\(\vert 0\rangle\)

netsquid.qubits.ketstates.s1 = array([[0.+0.j],        [1.+0.j]])

\(\vert 1\rangle\)

netsquid.qubits.ketstates.h0 = array([[0.70710678+0.j],        [0.70710678+0.j]])

\(\vert +\rangle = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\left(\vert 0\rangle + \vert 1\rangle \right)\)

netsquid.qubits.ketstates.h1 = array([[ 0.70710678+0.j],        [-0.70710678+0.j]])

\(\vert -\rangle = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\left(\vert 0\rangle - \vert 1\rangle \right)\)

netsquid.qubits.ketstates.y0 = array([[0.70710678+0.j        ],        [0.        +0.70710678j]])

\(\vert 0_Y\rangle = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\left(\vert 0\rangle + i\vert 1\rangle \right)\)

netsquid.qubits.ketstates.y1 = array([[ 0.70710678+0.j        ],        [-0.        -0.70710678j]])

\(\vert 1_Y\rangle = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\left(\vert 0\rangle - i\vert 1\rangle \right)\)

netsquid.qubits.ketstates.b00 = array([[0.70710678+0.j],        [0.        +0.j],        [0.        +0.j],        [0.70710678+0.j]])

\(\vert \beta_{00}\rangle = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\left(\vert 00\rangle + \vert 11\rangle \right)\)

netsquid.qubits.ketstates.b01 = array([[0.        +0.j],        [0.70710678+0.j],        [0.70710678+0.j],        [0.        +0.j]])

\(\vert \beta_{01}\rangle = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\left(\vert 01\rangle + \vert 10\rangle \right)\)

netsquid.qubits.ketstates.b10 = array([[ 0.70710678+0.j],        [ 0.        +0.j],        [ 0.        +0.j],        [-0.70710678+0.j]])

\(\vert \beta_{10}\rangle = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\left(\vert 00\rangle - \vert 11\rangle \right)\)

netsquid.qubits.ketstates.b11 = array([[ 0.        +0.j],        [ 0.70710678+0.j],        [-0.70710678+0.j],        [ 0.        +0.j]])

\(\vert \beta_{11}\rangle = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\left(\vert 01\rangle - \vert 10\rangle \right)\)

class netsquid.qubits.ketstates.BellIndex(value)

Bases: IntEnum

Indices corresponding to the four Bell states defined in bell_states.

B00

The index corresponding to \(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \left( \vert 00 \rangle + \vert 11 \rangle \right)\)

Type:

int

B01

The index corresponding to \(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \left( \vert 01 \rangle + \vert 10 \rangle \right)\)

Type:

int

B11

The index corresponding to \(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \left( \vert 01 \rangle - \vert 10 \rangle \right)\)

Type:

int

B10

The index corresponding to \(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \left( \vert 00 \rangle - \vert 11 \rangle \right)\)

Type:

int

PHI_PLUS

The index corresponding to \(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \left( \vert 00 \rangle + \vert 11 \rangle \right)\). Identical to B00.

Type:

int

PSI_PLUS

The index corresponding to \(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \left( \vert 01 \rangle + \vert 10 \rangle \right)\). Identical to B01.

Type:

int

PSI_MINUS

The index corresponding to \(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \left( \vert 01 \rangle - \vert 10 \rangle \right)\). Identical to B11.

Type:

int

PHI_MINUS

The index corresponding to \(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \left( \vert 00 \rangle - \vert 11 \rangle \right)\) Identical to B10.

Type:

int

Notes

The values correspond to the measurement operators, and thus must always be the values 0, 1, 2 or 3.

netsquid.qubits.ketstates.bell_states = {BellIndex.B00: array([[0.70710678+0.j],        [0.        +0.j],        [0.        +0.j],        [0.70710678+0.j]]), BellIndex.B01: array([[0.        +0.j],        [0.70710678+0.j],        [0.70710678+0.j],        [0.        +0.j]]), BellIndex.B11: array([[ 0.        +0.j],        [ 0.70710678+0.j],        [-0.70710678+0.j],        [ 0.        +0.j]]), BellIndex.B10: array([[ 0.70710678+0.j],        [ 0.        +0.j],        [ 0.        +0.j],        [-0.70710678+0.j]])}

The dictionary of four Bell states, indexed using BellIndex.
